song.title: Wouldn't You Like to Have a Pint of Beer
song.chorus: Oh wouldn't you like to have a pint of beer? Life is full of pain and misery Oh wouldn't you like to have a pint of beer? We'll raise a proper toast and keep you company
song.verse:
I went to work today A whistlin' on my way When I found out that I'd been given the slip
There was nothing left to say So I took my last pay And went to Kelly's pub to have meself a little nip
The temperance they came round A marching cross the town Cryin out against the demon gin Their faces scowled and frowned but donation of a pound Buys a trip to Kelly's pub where we can down our sin
I took miss Nancy Bo Out to see a show Where she met a man who played trombone And then that randy louse put his long thing in and out And now I sit in Kelly's pub a drinking all alone

My grandfather he died At the height of his manly pride Astride a dopty lass of twenty one As the family wailed and cried Me father took me aside And said let's go to Kelly's pub and toast his stamina

So if you're flat and broke And your gal's with another bloke And you don't have a clue what you should do I've got a proven cure That's simple, fast, and pure Just go to Kelly's pub with us and sob with someone new
